idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: The Tijuana River National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) digital boundary was created as part of the Protected Areas Geographic Information System (PAGIS) project. An updated digital version of Tijuana River's boundary was critical to the PAGIS project. The digital boundary was delineated from management and research areas within the Reserve. It was not based on legal definitions.
descript.purpose: The PAGIS project provided each NERR with a fully integrated geographic information system (GIS), encompassing spatial data and Internet capabilities. One of the essential GIS data layers being compiled for each Reserve was a digital boundary. The Reserve boundary was delineated based on management and research areas and is not meant to be a legal description of the Reserve.
descript.supplinf: This boundary is not to be taken as a legal definition of the NERR boundary. It was created based on management and research areas of the Reserve.

citeinfo.title: Tijuana River, California National Estuarine Research Reserve Digital Polygon Boundary
citeinfo.othercit: Originator located in Charleston, South Carolina USA

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.
cntorgp.cntorg: REQUIRED: The organization responsible for the metadata information.

cntaddr.addrtype: REQUIRED: The mailing and/or physical address for the organization or individual.
cntaddr.city: REQUIRED: The city of the address.
cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attracc.attraccr: The original attributes provided with the original digital file could not be tested for accuracy, but are believed to be accurate. All attributes created during the editing process were verified by displaying the lines in both the database and the spatial coverage.

dataqual.logic: These data are believed to be logically consistent, though no tests were performed. Polygon geometry is topologically clean.
dataqual.complete: The boundary of the Reserve is dependent on the shoreline and/or edges of rivers and bays as delineated on a USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map. The edges or borders of the boundary might change as the natural land changes or better maps and aerial photography become available. The boundary was not based on legal parcels or definitions; therefore, the core boundary is a management/research boundary not a legal boundary.

horizpa.horizpar: The data were created by delineating the boundary off a USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map at 1:24000 scale. Therefore, the horizontal accuracy is assumed to be within National Map Accuracy Standards, with a horizontal accuracy of 45.6 feet at the 95% confidence level.

vertacc.vertaccr: The data were delineated off a USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map at 1:24000 scale. Therefore, the vertical accuracy is assumed to be within National Map Accuracy Standards, with a vertical accuracy of 11.9 feet at the 95% confidence level.

procstep.procdesc: The original data from the US Fish and Wildlife Service was imported into ARC/INFO as a coverage from an ARC/INFO export format file. The coverage was then displayed on a USGS 7.5 minute topographic map to verify the boundary. No edits were done to the arcs. The polygon coverage was attributed and then projected to the final projection used by the individual Reserve.
